text: I wrote a python script to create a binary file of integers.

code:
import struct  
pos = [7623, 3015, 3231, 3829]  
inh = open('test.bin', 'wb')  
for e in pos:  
    inh.write(struct.pack('i', e))  
inh.close()

text: It worked well, then I tried to read the 'test.bin' file using the below code.

code:
import struct  
inh = open('test.bin', 'rb')  
for rec in inh:  
    pos = struct.unpack('i', rec)  
    print pos  
inh.close()

text: But it failed with an error message:

code:
Traceback (most recent call last):   
   File "readbinary.py", line 10, in <module>  
   pos = struct.unpack('i', rec)  
   File "/usr/lib/python2.5/struct.py", line 87, in unpack  
   return o.unpack(s)  
struct.error: unpack requires a string argument of length 4

text: I would like to know how I can read these file using struct.unpack.
